name: Sky Ranch Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the cabins and were very pleased. My family was very happy with the cabin and service at the Sky Ranch Lodge in Sedona. The view from or cabin was stunning and the grounds were very well kept. A+++
reviews.title: Cabin view was great!

reviews.text: I stayed at Sky Ranch March 08 with friends while visiting Sedona. I booked Sky Ranch after an internet search. I thought the place was terrific esp. for the price. Nicely landscapped, pool & jacuzzi. Friendly staff and you get a discount at the gift shop if you are a guest. Bedding should be updated though and we had to beg for extra pillows. We booked a courtyard view and the courtyard was lovely, but we were gone most of the time so we didn't really get to enjoy it much. Walk a very short distance to see the sunset. Sedona was awesome!
reviews.title: Loved Sky Ranch & Sedona

reviews.text: Agree with other posters, good location and quiet but needs a littile updating. Just replacing bedding alone would make a world of difference.
reviews.title: Agree - just okay

likes.disliked: — very outdated, absolutely no amenities, no non-smoking rooms

reviews.text: 2 adults, 1 child (11) stayed only one night so not really there very long. The front desk people very nice. The room was just okay kinda different. The room was very quiet which is a good thing for me as I am a light sleeper. We had a view room and the views were of course the reason why people stay here. The room was clean but very old but this is what we did expect from past reviews. I found the beds not that great it would be good for them to replace the beds in my opinion.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to file a complaint with the better business bureau regarding the Sky Ranch Lodge. They have an UNSATISFACTORY record with the BBB. We had so many problems and inconveniences with them, and the supposed "management" could not have cared less, actually writing back bold-faced lies in their response to our complaint.
reviews.title: Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced!!!!

likes.liked: — Sleeping, because that's the only time nothing went wrong, and I'm surprised!
likes.disliked: — Customer Service, Cold Shower, Smoke-filled non-smoking room, and Deceptive View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. I reserved a two-queen room, and the price was about half the cheapest rate elsewhere. Although the property itself may be older and the fixtures not modern, we found it adequate and quiet. There are a pool and a spa, both built in, as well as mature trees. It is close to everything in Sedona. It is walking distance from the airport, where you can take a helicopter tour or fixed-wing tour over Sedona. The staff at the front desk were friendly and have available the Red Rocks Pass, which you will need if you want to use any of the parking areas in the Red Rocks area. We would return here because of the convenient location and fabulous view of Sedona. Sky Ranch Lodge is charming.
reviews.title: High Above Town With a Low Price

reviews.text: I went to Sedona the weekend of April 4, 2008 with my sister and sister-in-law to do some hiking and to get away for a while. We booked a room at Sky Ranch Lodge. Although it was not my first choice for a hotel, I was familiar with it since I stayed there 2 years ago. I requested a double room with a roll-away since there were three of us. I volunteered to take the roll-away. It was the softest, lumpiest bed I've ever slept on. The matress must be as old as the hotel itself and needs to be replaced for sure.
reviews.title: Hotel OK, View Priceless

reviews.text: The room is adequate, but it needs a face-lift. There is a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee pot, which is great so you can have breakfast in your room as well as evening munchies and cocktails on the deck. The bathroom fixtures are very dated, as is the furnishings, but the room was clean. But the view from the deck at the back of our room was just georgeous. Sky Ranch Lodge is on Airport Road, at the top of the hill by the airport, so the view looks down into Sedona with red rock views across the city. Our room had a direct view to "Coffee Pot Rock" and the sunsets were just amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and there is a heated pool and jacuzzi that is open till 9PM. The hotel is out of the way a bit, so you have to drive to restaurants, shops, etc. After a day of hiking and walking through the shops, we wanted to order dinner for delivery. Options are severely limited, since only Domino's and Moon Dog Pizza (I think that is the name, great white pizza) deliver. So if you want to be in a quiet area of Sedona and don't mind driving to wherever you need to go, the trade-off is the awesome, undescribable views at Sky Ranch Lodge.
reviews.title: Great Price, Great Location, Great Atmosphere

reviews.text: My husband, 10 year old daughter and I stayed March 25-28 and we loved our stay. I searched forever to find a place with a reasonable price and I finally found it with the Sky Ranch Lodge. We only paid $85 a night for 2 Queen beds with private patio and garden view. Considering the Day's Inn's and Motel 8's were $105 a night, I thought this was a steal. Especially once we got there and saw the room, grounds and location. It was the largest room we had our entire trip. Nothing fancy, a little dated but it added to it's charm. We had 2 entrances to our room, 1 from the parking lot and 1 on the other side of the room leading to our private patio in the garden. The bathroom was clean and very large for a hotel. Our room had an entry, a nice size closet, dresser with tv, coffee maker, 2 queen beds, table and chairs and a large window looking out to the garden. Not to mention, free WiFi. The ceiling had wonderful beams on them, again added to the charm. Our patio was very cute with 2 chairs and a small table. Even though we technically had a garden view room, you could see the red rocks also. The gardens had wonderful walking paths and were beautiful. We saw a couple rabbit's and quail's running around. The heated pool and hot tub were nice. Again, a little dated but worked properly and they supplied towels. The pool was very nice to use after a long day of hiking and before dinner. The hot tub was awesome to hang out in to relax before bed. The front desk is not 24 hours but after a certain time if anything is needed you can call security. The best part about the Sky Ranch Lodge is the location. It is about a 5 minute drive from all the hustle and bustle of downtown Sedona. It looks down on Sedona so the views are spectacular and your not caught up in the mess and noise down below. Not to mention, the sunsets right from the resort is heavenly. If we ever get to go back to Sedona and I hope we do, we will be staying here again.
reviews.title: Great views of sunset and a comfortable place to stay

likes.liked: — location - away from tourist traps and great scenery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: although the room itself wasn't special in any way (and the beds too hard), it was more than adequate. The view, the garden, and the setting were delightful. The price was also very good. We would definitely recommend the Sky Ranch Lodge to others.
reviews.title: Wonderful gem of a place to stay

likes.disliked: — the bed was a bit hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I felt like I was comfortable enought to book this place for 4 days of stay. I was not disapointed. Although the rooms themselves are very outdated-we were not really in them enough to complain. The location was great. They also have a breathtaking view on the property of the red rocks and a lookout place to view the sunrise and sunset. We also ate at the airport restaraunt-which was nice. The property was gorgeous. They had beautiful landscaping with a small pond. We were able to relax a lot outside. Besides the fact that the lodge rooms are VERY outdated, I would stay there again for the value and location.
reviews.title: Nice little place
There's always a reason for price....
reviews.text: PS-I never heard a plane once while I was at the room!

Based on the great reviews, I reluctantly booked a room here knowing it was an older property. Well, we asked for a nonsmoking room. We get to the room and there is like a party on our porch with a couple of drinkers and smokers sitting right in front of our window partying with another couple on the same little porch. I immediately knew I didn't want to stay there. We walked in the room and it was soooo old and uninviting. We went to the front desk and told them about the smoking. They said that bldg. was no smoking. So why then are they putting smokers over there, I wondered. I asked for a refund and got into an argument about how they would only give us a refund if they could sell the room again. I highly protested and told them I would dispute any charge whatsoever on our Visa. We called the next morning from the Hampton Inn, okay place, not great, and they said they sold the room and did not charge our card. The place is not somewhere I wanted to stay.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Sedona

reviews.text: This is the best place to stay in Sedona. Beautiful decor. Nice hiking area full of cactus plants in the rear of the hotel. Walk to the Airport restauraunt. Staff was nice. There is a computer in the main office area where you can check your email.
reviews.title: best deal in sedona!

likes.liked: — they let us check in early, free internet, menus in the lobby, gift shop, beautiful grounds, great views, pool/hot tub, clean big room

reviews.text: We recently spent 5 nights at Sky Ranch.It is wonderful. So peaceful and easy to get to. Once you get there it is peaceful,cool and quite. The view is sooo good. The gardens are private and well kept. You can easily go back down to Sedona to hike, eat and see the canyons up close and personal. We always stay here and have NEVER been disappointed.
reviews.title: Sky Rance,peace on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the visitor centre at sedona recommended this hotel. the first impression of sedona was poor because of the road works entering the town. the hotel is a bit out of town and up by the sedona airport. the resort itself is fine basic but neat and tidy. the views are gorgeous from the resort and it does have a small pool and hot tub. you take breakfast at the airport cafe which was fine but the service was not up to much. the top end of sedona was much better as there were no roadworks going on.
reviews.title: beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We knew when we planned our NV/AZ trip that we wanted the last three days to be spent as a restful sabbatical in Sedona. Choosing just the best place to achieve that was thought out carefully. We knew we wanted to be in a place with a knock-out view, not near shopping, away from the crowds, but near town... a place to hide for a few days. We also wanted at the very minimal a mini fridge and microwave, as we were not planning on doing the foodie thing in Sedona. We wanted a place to retire to early after daytime exploring, a place to sip our wine in privacy and watch the sunsets, a place for moon and star gazing.
reviews.title: Comfortable and private hidden treasure

likes.liked: — Cozy and private, with a knock-out view
likes.disliked: — Driving out the driveway having to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could there exist a place on earth to achieve every one of our wishes? You bet it does, and I am so thankful that we learned about the Sky Ranch Lodge. It is not listed under regular motel listings, so we might have missed knowing about this wonderful oasis had it not been for the Sedona forums.
reviews.title: Great place for the price

likes.disliked: — odd smell in room/carpets old and frayed in some areas

reviews.text: We had a rim view, looking down the hill to the city lights, with the nicest little patio to sit on. Our patio had a low privacy wall that separated it from our neighbors, whom we seldom saw or heard. There was total quietness late at night sitting on that patio, except for the occasional coyote cry. We saw Coffee Pot formation in the moonlight, at dawn, at sunset, and all could be seen by lounging on the bed with the door open. What a dream!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

likes.disliked: — That I didnt get to stay longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walking around on the grounds of the property was relaxing and provided several cozy spots to just sit and enjoy the aura of the surroundings.
reviews.title: A little worn, but a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a no-frills hotel, where everything is clean, but a little worn and outdated. We stayed in Room 284, a double queen room with a patio. The room had a table and two chairs, cable tv, a small closet, a hair dryer, and a coffee maker.
reviews.title: High above touristy Sedona! :)

reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is its location atop Airport Mesa. It’s a mile up Airport Road, and away from the traffic (and construction) of the city, but still not too far away from anything. There are great views of the sunrise and sunset from Airport Mesa. And although the hotel advertises great views from its property, we never could find those.
reviews.title: Great Location, Awesome Views, Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms of the hotel surround a beautiful garden with fountains and picnic tables. And there is a nice little pool and hot tub on the property, although we were too tired to use them.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Beauty!!!!
FABULOUS location, large room, near all the sites but PRIVATE
reviews.text: The staff was helpful, giving us wonderful restaurant recommendations in addition to a list of local eateries. We ate at all three restaurants they recommended, and were pleased with all of them.

description: Sky Ranch Lodge sits on the edge of Airport Mesa, 500 feet above town, peacefully removed from all the hustle and bustle below. Massive red rock views tower in every direction from the hotel and the mesa is ringed by an easy hiking trail that offers eagle-eye views of Sedona's most stunning rock formations. These are the best views in all of Red Rock Country. Sky Ranch Lodge is famous for its richly landscaped grounds, teeming with gardens, shade trees, and ponds - often referred to as an oasis in the sky as well as "Sedona's best kept secret."
